summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel, likely from the New York Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART), discussing the copying of digital evidence from a 12 TB drive. The primary sender is traveling due to a family emergency and is coordinating the transfer of evidence to another location, possibly the Miami field office.

persons.name: I. (NY) (FBI)
persons.role: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: The primary sender of the emails, coordinating the copying and transfer of a 12 TB drive containing evidence. They mention traveling to Denver due to a family emergency.

persons.name: M. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Recipient of the emails, involved in the discussion about the 12 TB drive and its contents.

connections.description: FBI colleagues coordinating the handling and transfer of digital evidence (a 12 TB drive).

events.title: Coordination of 12 TB Drive Copying
events.description: FBI personnel discuss the ongoing, slow copying of data from a 12 TB drive containing evidence. Arrangements are made for others to oversee the process and for the drive to be transported to another location (Miami) upon completion.

locations: Southern (likely Southern District of New York or Miami field office)
keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email chain concerning the handling of a 12 TB drive containing digital evidence.
The evidence copying process is described as proceeding very slowly.
The primary agent is traveling to Denver due to a family emergency (sister in hospice), indicating the urgency and personal context of the coordination.
The document is subject to a protective order, restricting the disclosure of certain paragraphs.
The correspondence suggests routine but critical logistical work in a large-scale digital evidence investigation.
